intro: Potentilla × collina subsp. tomentosa, commonly known as silver cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in early summer, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
